page.title: 04LANDSCAPE _ Essendon
page.content:
{ESSENDON
Essendon is a small village at the top of a hill. Opposite the cricket field on the High Road is a shop. It sells groceries and has a post office. The telephone box is opposite the police house at the top of School Lane _ our policeman looks after Newgate Street and Essendon. We have a small play park with swings and a slide next to the school. The cricket field is used by the whole village. There are many picturesque cottages with pretty gardens in the summer. St Marys Church has an old cedar tree in the grounds. The Church is an interesting place to visit and there are many beautiful walks in the area. There are 850 people on the electoral roll and 6o children go to Essendon school. Most people work outside the village.
